data.text:
"Climate change is impacting communities. We have to work to help build their resilience."

@Agnes_Kalibata, Special Envoy for the @FoodSystems Summit, talks about #ClimateAction and achieving a #ZeroHunger world in the latest episode of Awake At Night. 🎧 https://t.co/lj0znj0Rcc https://t.co/adf6WtVfaV

17% of total food available to consumers is wasted, resulting in substantial environmental, social & economic impacts. 

Reducing food waste would cut greenhouse gas emissions, save money, and help create a #ZeroHunger world. More from @UNEP: https://t.co/kPSpSCPh4n

“This is the moment to turn the tables towards justice and end the military’s stranglehold over democracy in Myanmar.”

-- @UNHumanRights chief @mbachelet. https://t.co/lgLjuRQE3Z https://t.co/lx6Hadlerc

#COVID19 has disproportionality affected people with obesity, who are more likely to develop severe disease & be hospitalised.

At the same time, the pandemic has made combating obesity even more difficult. @WHO has nutrition tips on #WorldObesityDay: https://t.co/kX8l9f78uy https://t.co/55IEyB8DtI

Greater inclusivity to create a more diverse engineering workforce will be needed to achieve the #GlobalGoals. 

More from @UNESCO on Thursday's #WorldEngineeringDay: https://t.co/YRJzVvjj9X https://t.co/MZeeYTN4cZ

🍟 🍦 Less fats and sugars
🥬🍊 More fruit and vegetables

On Thursday's #WorldObesityDay, @WHO has more nutrition tips: https://t.co/e4mSPZpxLa

COVAX is the UN-led initiative to ensure equitable access to #COVID19 vaccines for everyone. The rollout has begun, but how does it work and which countries get the vaccines? 

Here are 5 things you need to know:
https://t.co/MJoMDyN7Bt

Worldwide obesity has nearly tripled since 1975, with about 40% of adults overweight & 13% obese.

The good news is that obesity is preventable & treatable. Details from @WHO on Thursday's #WorldObesityDay: https://t.co/swRmMMUdmU https://t.co/MrULkz3VOA

Good health news!

Colombia became the first country in the Americas to receive #COVID19 vaccines through COVAX —  the UN-led initiative to ensure equitable vaccine access for everyone.

#OnlyTogether can we end the pandemic. https://t.co/nJHh56pHNT https://t.co/TjADjN12IF

On Wednesday we celebrated #WorldWildlifeDay, highlighting the importance of protecting our forests and their ecosystems. 

More in our latest @TwitterMoments: https://t.co/oPuqHm9p1C

• Heart disease
• Diabetes
• Cancer

These are only some of the serious health problems caused by overweight & obesity. @WHO explains how to prevent them on Thursday's #WorldObesityDay: https://t.co/spNkm4PXUx https://t.co/aWu7jvKYaN

Sudan & Rwanda are the latest beneficiaries to receive lifesaving #COVID19 vaccines through the UN-led COVAX initiative to ensure equitable vaccine access for everyone.

None of us are safe until all of us are safe. #OnlyTogether can we end the pandemic. 
https://t.co/ZD0FFHQafN

🌳🌲 Forests cover 30% of the Earth's surface and provide food security & shelter. They are also key to tackling the climate crisis. 

On Wednesday's #WorldWildlifeDay, find out how the #GlobalGoals aim to protect them: https://t.co/MX5SPAGmWN https://t.co/iXOw3YRjxS

Wednesday is World Birth Defects Day.

Although it is difficult to identify the exact causes, some congenital anomalies can be prevented through vaccinations, folic acid supplements & adequate antenatal care. 

More from @WHO: https://t.co/ZdVJcgIQCM https://t.co/9nFDqT2jga

Forests are home to 80% of all terrestrial wildlife. 

The ecosystems they sustain are essential to global biodiversity, human livelihoods & the broader needs of societies & economies globally.

More on Wednesday's #WorldWildlifeDay: https://t.co/LuyV8dWL1T https://t.co/AClmyEAxxY

460+ million people worldwide live with hearing loss, yet, many of the causes of hearing loss are preventable.

More from @WHO on Wednesday’s #WorldHearingDay: https://t.co/Lt0aL7ZVEc https://t.co/DKjDd90klk

About 8 million babies are born with a birth defect every year worldwide, of which 300,000+ die due to associated complications. 

On Wednesday's World Birth Defects Day, @WHO has details on how to help prevent, detect and treat congenital anomalies: https://t.co/sYsM25KrHZ https://t.co/dCROIMnuup

For centuries, forests have provided livelihoods for hundreds of millions of people, especially within indigenous communities.

Forests, wildlife & biodiversity need protection. 

Help spread the word on Wednesday's #WorldWildlifeDay. https://t.co/LuyV8dWL1T https://t.co/YFfChLLY7r

"We can power past coal and have economies that thrive on innovative businesses aligned to what the world is demanding — sustainable development and prosperity for people & planet."

-- @antonioguterres calls for the phasing out of coal. https://t.co/TJt8Cfg2xR #ClimateAction https://t.co/tb5rfniaLK

March is #WomensHistoryMonth!

Join @UN_Women in celebrating women’s activism & get to know some of the inspirational figures that have helped to promote women's rights around the world. #GenerationEquality 
https://t.co/JSjccxZIv6

.@FAO & @iaeaorg have been working together to combat animal diseases for more than 40 years.

Now, amid #COVID19, they are strengthening their partnership to focus on achieving food security while also tackling zoonotic diseases. https://t.co/x0FR0OFIOQ https://t.co/bboUm2b1Cz

"Women & children feel comfortable sharing their lives with us."
-- @unmissmedia's First Lieutenant Natsagdorj Delgermaa on the key role of women in @UNPeacekeeping missions. 

More on their critical contributions to peace & security: https://t.co/JlWYyEQpfh #A4P https://t.co/dyh4RpuXSV

Better data is key for improving and saving lives.

Statisticians from all over the world will meet virtually this week for the UN Statistical Commission to discuss measuring progress on the #GlobalGoals & more. https://t.co/AtqLk4BQTN https://t.co/fVIVv6MtH1

Ghana & Côte d'Ivoire made history Monday, administering the first does of #COVID19 vaccines provided through COVAX - the UN-led initiative to ensure equitable vaccine access for everyone.

https://t.co/1DHianJlya

"Millions of Yemeni children, women and men desperately need aid to live. Cutting aid is a death sentence."

-- @antonioguterres urges countries to "help stave off the worst famine the world has seen in decades". https://t.co/nrGTM7H9b8 #YemenCantWait https://t.co/EGPGWAJWAx

"In unity and solidarity, we will overcome this crisis" -- @antonioguterres

As the world comes together in the face of the #COVID19 pandemic, get inspired by examples of hope & kindness in our latest @TwitterMoments: https://t.co/4gl9yNUPpI

No one should ever face discrimination because of their HIV status. 

Yet, stigma risks the health, dignity and security of people living with or affected by HIV. More from @UNAIDS on Monday's #ZeroDiscrimination Day: https://t.co/69KivroT6j https://t.co/wm0TLasToc

The humanitarian crisis in Yemen is the worst in the world & the country is on the brink of a massive famine. 

On Monday, donors will come together to pledge their support for addressing Yemen's urgent humanitarian needs. https://t.co/Yr0z4etZhm #YemenCantWait via @UNOCHA https://t.co/y9iZJzz9St

Workplace discrimination is a human rights violation, with far-reaching social & economic consequences. 

More from @UNAIDS on Monday's #ZeroDiscrimination Day: https://t.co/69KivroT6j https://t.co/MTDu4nSoBL
The United States of America assumes the presidency of the Security Council for the month of March. Follow @USUN for updates. https://t.co/hEl1XTYUoD https://t.co/9zXzKPoiuA

Discrimination based on sexual orientation is a violation of human rights.

See how you can help end inequalities on Monday's #ZeroDiscrimination Day and every day. https://t.co/69KivroT6j via @UNAIDS https://t.co/GOYtTTii7I

Amid #COVID19, misinformation can be deadly.

But all of us can do something about it. Use these tips to help verify facts before you share something online. 

#OnlyTogether can we overcome the pandemic. 

https://t.co/LV9n3DFvZe https://t.co/WuVkuDIWLa

Everyone, everywhere, has the right to health - regardless of their income. 

On Monday's #ZeroDiscrimination Day, join @UNAIDS in standing up for the right to health for all. https://t.co/69KivroT6j https://t.co/gOG8GUJA0L

Living more sustainably doesn't have to be difficult.

The new #ActNow app helps you protect our planet through fun and engaging actions you can track. https://t.co/4i2kqgHfrb #ClimateAction https://t.co/8XxgxZEOOm

"I used to walk a long distance to get to school from the refugee camp."

In our latest Awake At Night podcast, @Agnes_Kalibata, the Special Envoy for the 2021 @FoodSystems Summit, shares her life story of growing up in a refugee camp in Uganda. https://t.co/lj0znjisAM https://t.co/1AXhjH2wzL

Conflict in one country can have regional & global repercussions. 

UN Peacekeepers serve in missions around the world to prevent the spread of conflict & violence. 

More on their efforts from @UNPeacekeeping: https://t.co/wJQAozBoga #A4P https://t.co/esN15iw5vd

As #BlackHistoryMonth comes to an end, watch this tribute to former UN official & Nobel Laureate Ralph Bunche, an "incurable optimist" who dedicated his life to achieving peace & ending oppression worldwide. https://t.co/9f5PS3gNsN

Physical distancing does not have to mean social or emotional isolation.

Stay connected with your loved ones. 

We are in this together -- and we will get through this together.

🎨: @karinamuranaga https://t.co/JC3iar93ud

Millions of people have been forced from their homes in the Democratic Republic of Congo due to conflict & violence.

Many are finding refuge with families who share what little they have. 

@UNOCHA brings us their inspiring stories of solidarity. 
https://t.co/8vitBouxOr

Current #ClimateAction plans are not enough to meet the #ParisAgreement goals of reducing global temperature rise. 

2021 is an unprecedented opportunity to address the climate crisis by using #COVID19 recovery to build back greener. 

#ItsPossible 

https://t.co/t1I8ReqeFT

The #COVID19 pandemic risks reversing a decade of hard-won gains in global efforts to provide nutritious food to the world's most vulnerable children through free daily meals in school. 

Latest from @WFP: https://t.co/1azJaHHHsd https://t.co/ONmcSQVZAP

Human rights are our bloodline and our lifeline, but they are under attack every day, @antonioguterres at this week's Human Rights Council. https://t.co/Nyjuqk8V7j #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/h04ruHAL32

Welcome to the UN family, @gugumbatharaw! 

The actor - and newest @Refugees Goodwill Ambassador - will be using her voice to help the most vulnerable in these challenging times. https://t.co/SnaFip53fN #WithRefugees

This week, the biggest immunisation campaign in history, led by the UN, began as #COVID19 vaccines funded by the international community arrived in Ghana. 

#OnlyTogether can we end the pandemic. https://t.co/v5aGuCCM50 https://t.co/1bPrgESiCr

"Climate change is a threat to global security that can only be dealt with by unparalleled levels of global cooperation."

This week, Sir David Attenborough spoke to the Security Council about the urgent need for #ClimateAction.  https://t.co/ANImLS38im https://t.co/Nx2VMJXqWu

While the UNHQ complex in NYC remains closed to the public due to #COVID19, you can #VisitUN from anywhere. 

Book a virtual tour with one of our multilingual tour guides here: https://t.co/kRY5hp7m2c https://t.co/HKc9APj9xE

#COVID19 is threatening to reverse years of progress to #EndChildLabour. 

Now is the time to take action to build a world where every child can enjoy a safe & free childhood. https://t.co/GQ7W6xd2MX via @ilo https://t.co/3nvdxhdMAp
Nigeria: @UNICEF condemns attack on secondary school; calls for immediate release of hundreds of kidnapped schoolgirls. https://t.co/UUxZVaCx2H

"I strongly condemn the recent steps taken by the military & urge all of you to collectively send a clear signal in support of democracy in Myanmar."

-- Special Envoy @SchranerBurgen1 tells #UNGA. https://t.co/vbGRu0UL4r

This year, countries must submit new #ClimateAction plans under the #ParisAgreement.

Where we stand:
Plans detailing a 1% emissions reduction by 2030

What we need:
Updated plans reaching a 45% emissions reduction.

@UNFCCC explains how #ItsPossible: https://t.co/9WwLxQwnbz https://t.co/i64QFS3sMV

Young people are key for addressing the climate crisis. 

On Friday, join a diverse group of youth at the forefront of creative #ClimateAction for an intergenerational conversations with policy makers about how to drive local action to protect our planet. https://t.co/UzFX6hOFOO https://t.co/zeBaSh47Wo

Cultural & creative industries are a powerful economic sector, strengthened by digitalization & a surge in services during the #COVID19 pandemic. 

2021 is the International Year of Creative Economy for Sustainable Development. https://t.co/A55yxIEpgt via @UNCTAD https://t.co/qYGVnfIAjw

"Around 60% of Syrians - 12.4 million people - do not have regular access to enough safe and nutritious food."

-- @UNReliefChief in briefing to Security Council on desperate situation in Syria. https://t.co/THvCj1npM7

Ghana became the first country to receive #COVID19 vaccines through a UN-led initiative aimed at ensuring fair & equitable vaccine access.

See other ways we are taking action to combat the pandemic in our latest collection of @TwitterMoments. https://t.co/iHYt8l3kra

The long-term symptoms of #COVID19 can last for months. 

Stay safe by following these 4 steps:
😷Wear a mask
🙂↔️🙂Physically distance
🧼Wash hands
🪟Open doors & windows

More tips from @WHO: https://t.co/FU7mXKXzGg https://t.co/TukUzdVDo1

Bribery costs an estimated $1.5 to $2 trillion a year.

New UN report stresses importance of global cooperation for a fairer, more transparent international financial system and investments in the #GlobalGoals. https://t.co/lfTORFEdWz https://t.co/P0HQKhiMcL

The world faces two possible futures: 

All nations unite to bring #COVID19 under control. 

Or, two classes emerge - a vaccinated class & an unvaccinated class.

More in new joint Op-Ed from the UN's @MelissaFleming & @WebMD's @DrJohnWhyte. 

https://t.co/j3ePngiSpD

95% of the food we eat comes from our soils -- yet, this natural resource is disappearing. You can help reverse land degradation by:
🔹 Buying local produce
🔹 Reducing food waste
🔹 Composting
More from @FAO: https://t.co/9JKK03JWBJ

https://t.co/Kosyirkonq

"The Western world worries about the #COVID19. Yemen can't even afford to worry about it because we have malaria, chikungunya, cholera & dengue. Plus, there is a famine."

-- @Refugees's @jnbeuze talks about his concerns for Yemenis on Awake At Night. https://t.co/M9VY24kwHf https://t.co/F6BN8HLVnP

Welcome to the UN family, @NataSupernova!

The supermodel & philanthropist - and new @UNFPA Goodwill Ambassador - will help empower women & girls by tackling the stigma & taboos that surround women's bodies & health. https://t.co/j5qEa2ZSOs https://t.co/A0HBCB4eSi

Central African Republic: Violence & volatility continue to plague the country, despite successful presidential elections & other important progress, @UNPeacekeeping chief @Lacroix_UN tells UN Security Council. https://t.co/J4KeNobtD6

An historic moment in the fight against #COVID19: the global vaccine rollout through the UN-led COVAX initiative has begun in Ghana.

#OnlyTogether can we end the pandemic. https://t.co/v5aGuCUmWy https://t.co/3l7JchXJEF

School closures amid #COVID19 deprived 370 million children globally of school meals. For many, that was the only nutritious meal of the day.

Latest from @WFP. https://t.co/1azJaHHHsd

https://t.co/1goE17liDl

Good health news!

Ghana has become the first country to receive #COVID19 vaccines through COVAX, a UN-led initiative to ensure equitable vaccine access for everyone.

More on this historic step to end the pandemic. https://t.co/v5aGuCCM50 https://t.co/aQPFTKjd93

"Much like #COVID19 vaccines, human rights will not lead to a healthier world if they are only available to the privileged few."

-- @antonioguterres stresses the importance of protecting human rights for everyone, everywhere. https://t.co/ajJ12CHwsm #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/NkeUHNutgU

.@UNICEF's first deliveries of syringes for #COVID19 vaccinations have arrived – a major accomplishment in global efforts to end the pandemic.

Up to 1 billion syringes will be provided to nations around the world this year. https://t.co/6SnA4iyqRb

"Just 10 countries have administered more than 75% of all #COVID19 vaccines.  

Vaccine equity affirms human rights. 

Vaccine nationalism denies it.

Vaccines must be a global public good, accessible & affordable for all." 

-- @antonioguterres https://t.co/Nyjuqk8V7j https://t.co/gPZCgLMUtQ

.@UN_Vienna may be closed to visitors, but you can still #VisitUN with a virtual tour.

Join one of the multilingual guides to see how the UN works around the world to address some of the most pressing challenges facing humanity. https://t.co/DvL51Wq5Ja https://t.co/3SXZvTjWws

Since 1948, @UNPeacekeeping has helped end conflicts and foster reconciliation through successful operations in dozens of countries.

More on their efforts to make the world a more peaceful & prosperous place: https://t.co/1AkYG74EeJ #A4P https://t.co/WWechBgR5J

"Much more needs to be done to address the specific risks the climate crisis poses to peace and security."

-- @antonioguterres calls for immediate and urgent #ClimateAction in the Security Council. https://t.co/dE8tXLkDcg https://t.co/8Gk4hHVvHe

@UNICEF's first deliveries of syringes for #COVID19 vaccinations have arrived – a major accomplishment in global efforts to end the pandemic.

Up to 1 billion syringes will be provided to nations around the world this year. https://t.co/6SnA4iyqRb

The growth of digital labour platforms amid #COVID19 is creating new opportunities. Yet, when it comes to creating decent work, challenges remain. 

@ilo is calling for global cooperation to ensure everyone can enjoy their fundamental rights at work. https://t.co/vP66kVtSZt https://t.co/jPuxkNcvLJ

"Climate change is a threat to global security that can only be dealt with by unparalleled levels of global co-operation."

Sir. David Attenborough tells Security Council that we can create a stable & healthy world where we thrive in balance with nature. https://t.co/3QKMYqRPkW https://t.co/5zLQkZn84r

From increasing food insecurity to prompting mass displacement, the climate crises can increase the risk of conflict in various ways.

On Tuesday, the Security Council meets to discuss the relationship between the climate emergency and peace & security. https://t.co/WhwXXmCYWf https://t.co/OzEbgYxxpi

With the #COVID19 pandemic shining a spotlight on human rights, recovery gives us an opportunity to generate momentum for transformation.

-- @antonioguterres at Human Rights Council. https://t.co/Nyjuqk8V7j #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/k7XUW1PXxr

Photographers from around the world have depicted the power of human rights in a new exhibition called 'Photography 4 Humanity'. 

Check out the virtual exhibit from the UN and #StandUp4HumanRights: https://t.co/PSE0mraDYK https://t.co/X7IYxzUOvM

“Growing political tensions threaten Somalia’s State-building progress and even security.”

@UNSomalia chief James Swan briefed the Security Council and urged all of Somalia’s political leaders to pull back from confrontation. https://t.co/REFJ48kCdK

We can defeat this pandemic -- together.

Check out our latest compilation of @TwitterMoments, which show the very best of humanity amid the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/c8nBzs3xz1

The #COVID19 pandemic has further exacerbated entrenched discrimination against women and girls. The crisis has a woman’s face.

-- @antonioguterres at Human Rights Council. https://t.co/NyjuqjRjIJ #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/1uSU74NsEd

Yemen has one of the highest rates of child malnutrition in the world. 

Watch as @WFP delivers vital nutrition in one of the most remote areas of the country to help kids survive & thrive. https://t.co/I7OY52z5cq
 https://t.co/iaFGbEGRoR

From lost jobs to social isolation to missed school lessons, #COVID19 has had a profound affect on people's lives around the world. 

Share your experiences and coping mechanisms during crisis in this survey: https://t.co/940dOuLH09 via @UNUWIDER https://t.co/7JC0daPkWw

Human rights are our bloodline and our lifeline, but they are under attack every day, @antonioguterres tells the opening session of the Human Rights Council. https://t.co/Nyjuqk8V7j #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/zlIYsbmftJ

British celebrity gardener and @FAO advocate Monty Don is raising awareness of the links between human & plant health, and how our choices are inter-connected with the well-being of the planet. https://t.co/O1J1eV0BfA

“Injustice was something I could not accept.”

-- @refugees's @jnbeuze shares with @MelissaFleming what drove him to dedicate his life to help others in difficult & dangerous situations. 

🎧 Listen to his story on our podcast 'Awake At Night': https://t.co/M9VY242VPH https://t.co/yrB8d7dndQ

People become refugees not by choice, but forced by circumstances.

For 70 years, @Refugees has worked to save lives, protect rights & build a better future for refugees, forcibly displaced communities & stateless people. https://t.co/h9sBXHUK7v https://t.co/kb4hdM1F8f

On Sunday's #MotherLanguageDay & every day, check out how you can follow the UN in different languages: 

French: @ONU_fr
Spanish: @ONU_es
Arabic: @UNarabic
Russian: @UnitedNationsRU
Hindi: @UNinHindi
Kiswahili: @UmojaWaMataifa
Portuguese: @NacoesUnidas

https://t.co/1Zv0mzzeJN https://t.co/UJOBWO4TJx

Despite #COVID19, @UNMAS experts continue working around the world to reduce the threat of landmines and explosive remnants of war.

More on their efforts to create #SafeGround for all: https://t.co/cA3UmvaUAV https://t.co/fVbCRE7QZA

Happy #MotherLanguageDay! 

Cultural and linguistic diversity are key for sustainable and peaceful societies. https://t.co/8DyBnfibet via @UNESCO https://t.co/i5z7SdxKlE

#COVID19 has shown how important it is to listen to scientists and spread verified information. 

Be a #ClimateAction Superhero - help counter climate change misinformation with facts and scientific evidence. https://t.co/nAjeCAHlAC #ActNow https://t.co/FgFPjjbDv8

"Racism plagues our world. It is abhorrent. It is ugly. And it is everywhere. We must condemn it without reservation, without hesitation, without qualification."  

-- @antonioguterres https://t.co/XkMnmx62Qf #FightRacism https://t.co/bxUg5ayqRA

In many countries, students are taught in a language other than their mother tongue, which compromises their ability to learn effectively. 

On Sunday's #MotherLanguageDay, join @UNESCO in calling for mother tongue-based education: https://t.co/0IswlW4vSX https://t.co/oDFFWq1yoE

🌳Forest & land conservation
☀ Renewable energy
🌾 Climate-friendly farming techniques
👷‍♀️Green businesses & jobs

These are the top 4 #ClimateAction policies people around the world want to see, according to @UNDP's #PeoplesClimateVote. https://t.co/BUtq8LpaBP https://t.co/8qlHEYnwjb

"This is good news for the United States — and for the world."

On Friday, @antonioguterres officially welcomed the USA back into the #ParisAgreement on climate change. https://t.co/HjUhpmYPyp #ClimateAction https://t.co/OlqdkisWtl

As #COVID19 challenges communities & countries around the world, the UN continues to support the global struggle against the virus in many ways.   

Find some examples of our work in this new collection of @Twittermoments. https://t.co/J8J8foJJh6

The #ParisAgreement is an international treaty which aims to address the climate emergency and to help strengthen resilience.

As we work towards recovery from #COVID19, we must build back greener for our planet & our future. https://t.co/2NtTTKIGyB https://t.co/Dx66u47IXT

Social justice is only possible when all barriers people face based on gender, race, ethnicity, religion, culture or disability are removed. 

Saturday is #SocialJusticeDay. https://t.co/uwnxdxRQhW https://t.co/zt2VhxgHd9

Sport teaches girls how to:
👏 Stand in solidarity
💪 Be resilient & confident
🤼‍♀️ Trust teamwork

#WomenInSport defy gender stereotypes & social norms, make inspiring role models & demonstrate equality. https://t.co/WjijKfI1Il via @UN_Women #GenerationEquality https://t.co/cyWdfQZs3I
